abstracts.cdata!:
This Result Profile talks about
            improving health services for the poor in Cambodia. Some of
            the challenges faced by Cambodia included significant health
            inequities among the socio-economic groups creating an
            impact largely on maternal and child health outcomes. It was
            particularly difficult for the remote and rural populations
            to access health services. The Health Sector Support Project
            improved both the accessibility and the quality of health
            services in Cambodia. In 2008, an estimated 2.3 million poor
            people were covered by the Health Equity Fund (HEF) schemes.
            The project’s support for national disease control programs
            contributed to reduce dengue fever outbreaks, TB and Malaria
            infection, and mortality.
